alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Sublette (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 11:25AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .High-elevation snowmelt continues and automated snowpack estimates reveal about 5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet west of La Barge. Approximately 1 inch of snow water equivalent is being melted each day. This snowmelt will continue to keep the water level on the Green River elevated. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Green River near La Barge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding of low lying agricultural land next to gage. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Nearby homes begin to see high water. Fields south of town around the gaging station have ponded water (less than 1 foot deep). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Saturday, June 10, the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to hover around 8.3 feet through Sunday afternoon, then drop to 8.0 feet around mid- day Monday. It will then drop below action stage. Precipitation with storms this weekend and early next week may add to the river flows and keep it from going below action stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay away from riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water and could easily collapse. Please report observed flooding to local law enforcement or emergency management and request the information be shared with the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
